details.description: Get business support over the phone if you can't access the internet - starting up and running a business
details.body:
Get business support and advice over the phone when youâ€™re unable to access the internet or online business support services.

The helpline provides a quick response service to people with simple questions about starting or running a business. It also provides a more in-depth service for those with more complex enquiries.

Business Link Helpline
Telephone: 0845 600 9006
Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm

details.description: Includes Self Assessment, self-employment and starting a business
Information about starting up and running a business in the UK, including help if you're self employed or a sole trader.
Includes registering, setting up, company accounts and tax returns
Information about starting up and running a business in the UK, including help if you're self employed or a sole trader.
Training for different business sectors is developed by sector skills councils. Search the Sector Skills Councils Alliance website for courses and qualifications.
Search for publicly-backed finance or support schemes based on basic information about your business including location and type
Find out where you can get information about your business market and how to use this to improve your business - business strategy, knowledge management
